Ad Text:
- Role can be worked in Canberra, Sydney or Queensland
- Minimum Baseline Clearance Required
- 3-year contract + 12-month extension

We are seeking experienced Senior Performance Testers to lead performance testing strategy and execution across complex enterprise systems in a large government environment. This role is suited to a performance testing specialist who can define long-term approaches, integrate testing into agile delivery, and provide clear performance insights to technical and business stakeholders.

Key responsibilities include:

Developing and implementing a performance testing strategy, including automation-led approaches
Integrating performance testing into scaled Agile delivery
Designing, scripting, executing, and reporting performance tests using tools such as LoadRunner
Creating detailed performance test plans, simulation models, and schedules
Analysing system performance across multi-technology platforms
Identifying and communicating performance risks and recommendations
Producing clear performance reports and ensuring documentation meets recordkeeping standards
Mandatory experience & qualifications:

6+ years’ experience as a Performance Test Lead
Strong experience with LoadRunner
Script development experience across protocols such as Web (HTTP/HTML), Web Services, Java, Siebel, Mobile, and Citrix/VDI
Strong SQL and troubleshooting skills
Experience with performance analysis, monitoring, and test estimation
Familiarity with Agile, Waterfall, and hybrid delivery methodologies
ISTQB Foundation Certificate (or equivalent)
ISTQB Advanced Level Test Analyst (or equivalent)
ISTQB Advanced Level Agile Technical Tester (or equivalent)
ISTQB Foundation Agile Extension Certificate (or equivalent)
Desirable:

ISTQB Advanced Test Manager or Test Automation Engineer certifications
Experience with DevOps and CI/CD practices
Certification in performance or automation tools
For further information, please reach out to madison.lustri@mtpservices.com.au.

Job Title: Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) SME / Delivery Lead
Ad Text:
Company description:



CAPGEMINI SERVICE SAS



Job description:

Your Role

As a Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) Tool SME within the Experience Management Office, you will play a key role in shaping and elevating the digital experiences of our employees. You'll be responsible for the expert management, configuration, and optimization of DEM platforms such as SysTrack and Nexthink. By analysing rich performance and experience data, you will help identify issues, uncover improvement opportunities, and drive initiatives that enhance productivity and employee satisfaction across the organisation.


Own the configuration, performance, and overall health of DEM tools to ensure accurate and meaningful insight generation.
Monitor digital experience data to identify trends, performance gaps, and user‑impacting issues.
Translate technical findings into clear, actionable insights to improve the digital work environment.
Support the evolution of the DEM platform ecosystem by contributing to enhancements, best practices, and new capability development.
Your Experience

Technical Skills

Strong hands‑on experience with key modules (e.g., SysTrack DEX Pack, Campaigns, extensions; Nexthink Experience Central, Engagement, Remote Actions).
PowerShell Automation - advanced scripting and workflow automation.
Windows Administration including Windows Server and desktop management.
Solid SQL experience for data querying and analysis.
Ability to design and architect effective technical solutions.

Analytic Skills

Performance data analysis to identify trends and issues
Integrating DEM tool data with other systems.y
Creating clear reports and dashboards.

Interpersonal and Strategic Skills

Effective collaboration across IT teams.
Strong communication of insights and technical concepts.
Identifying and leading automation opportunities.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies
Strong troubleshooting and issue-resolution skills

Job Title: Finance Functions - Manager Planning and Reporting | Perth or Brisbane
Ad Text:
About BHP 


At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role


We are seeking a high performing professional to lead the Technical Planning & Reporting (P&R) team, supporting the Technical function across all core planning, forecasting and insights activities. This role plays a critical part in driving functional excellence, strengthening cost discipline, and enabling strategic decision-making across Technical.
 
You will lead a team of Planning & Reporting professionals responsible for delivering high quality planning outputs, including the 2 Year Budget, forecasts, and monthly performance insights. You will also oversee ad hoc analysis and improvement initiatives that support our stakeholders and uplift Technical P&R capability.

Key Accountabilities:

Coordinate and execute Technical P&R analytics to improve cost and productivity outcomes.
Deliver and manage the corporate alignment planning (CAP) cycle across the entire Technical portfolio including Technology, Digital, Exploration, Innovation, Legacy Assets, and Technical Centres of Excellence.
Confidently present ideas, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at varying levels.
Manage and guide team members to ensure accuracy, timeliness, and compliance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Finance, Assets, Functions) to support strategic decision-making.

About You


Strong stakeholder management in a global environment and ability to build effective relationships.
Ability to prioritize and work in highly ambiguous, fast-paced environments.
Experience in financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting.
Comfortable working across multiple locations and time zones.
Advanced data analysis skills (modelling and analytics experience is advantageous).
About Our Process 


At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks. 

If you are already employed directly by BHP, please log in using your BHP email address or apply via our internal jobs portal. 

Supporting a Diverse Workforce  
 


The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.  

At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that’s more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognise that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.

BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.

Company Description


Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

About the Role/Team

Finance at Canva is on an exciting journey—scaling the foundations that support a rapidly growing global company, while making our processes smarter, simpler, and more empowering for our teams. The Finance Transformation team sits at the heart of this mission.

We're looking for a Finance Transformation Senior Manager who’s passionate about solving complex problems, improving processes end-to-end, and helping teams work more efficiently through technology, automation, and AI-enabled solutions. You’ll work cross-functionally across Finance, along with Finance Systems, Finance Data and the broader business, helping shape and execute Canva’s finance transformation projects — with a focus on process reengineering, driving simplification, automation and AI-driven solutions. You’ll help share the future of how Finance works at Canva.

If you love digging into business processes, running cross-functional projects, driving change, and finding opportunities to streamline and simplify — this role is made for you.

What you’ll do (responsibilities)

Lead Finance Process Transformation: Identify, design, and deliver scalable improvements across key global finance processes (Revenue, Billing, Payables, Reporting, etc.), balancing innovation with strong control and compliance. Help embed AI-enabled ways of working, drive adoption and education, help teams identify problems and expected outcomes - focusing on efficiency, accuracy, repeatability, and standardisation.
Project, Program and Change Management: Lead transformation programs of varying scale, ensuring cross-functional stakeholder alignment, governance, and smooth change adoption across teams. Coordinate project activities, dependencies, and timelines to ensure alignment between teams.Help unblock, remove ambiguity, and support smooth project execution.
Drive Technology Enablement: Partner with Finance Systems, Data, and Engineering teams to implement automation, system integrations, and AI-based solutions that streamline end-to-end workflows.
Help shape the Transformation Roadmap: Collaborating with finance and business leaders to define the strategic direction for the Finance Technology stack and transformation priorities.
Data, Insight & Automation: Champion data-driven decision-making - ensuring finance data is leveraged effectively for reporting, analytics, and automation.

What we're looking for

Significant experience in Finance Transformation, or Process Improvement roles (experience in fast-scaling tech, SaaS, or global environments strongly preferred).
A background in Finance with a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field is a big plus.
Experience with driving process redesign. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, able to break down ambiguity into actionable steps.
Familiarity with finance ERP, billing and reporting systems (e.g., Workday, Netsuite, Zuora, Salesforce, Anaplan) and an understanding of data and automation and AI platforms.
Proven ability to lead large scale transformation programs end-to-end from strategy and design to implementation and embedding.
A balance of big-picture vision and detail orientation, with a strong understanding of finance processes and data flows.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills; able to work cross-functionally without effort, translating between finance, technical and business teams.
Growth mindset. Passion for continuous improvement and leveraging new technologies (AI, automation, analytics) to elevate finance impact and scale finance operations.

We'd love it if you have:

Familiarity with Agile, Lean, or continuous improvement approaches.

We’re a small new team that is just getting started, so you aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves, get into the detail. Able to determine and play whatever role is needed to make projects a success: analyst, project coordinator, facilitator, tester, or change champion.

Why You’ll Love It Here

You’ll shape the future of how finance operates at one of the world’s most loved design platforms.

You’ll work with world-class teams across Finance, IT, Data and the business in an environment that encourages experimentation and learning.

You’ll have autonomy and ownership to lead high-impact transformation initiatives that directly influence Canva’s scalability and success.

What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too
Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers
An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more
Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

Our consulting partner is supporting a Federal Government client to engage a Performance Monitoring & Reporting Specialist to join a Performance & Quality team.
The role focuses on analysing performance data, designing KPIs, and delivering high-quality operational and performance reporting to support data-led decision-making across the organisation.
⚠️ Australian Citizenship with an active NV1 security clearance is required.
Key Responsibilities
Analyse operational, financial, and performance metrics
Design, monitor, and enhance KPI frameworks
Deliver accurate and timely performance reports
Identify trends and insights to support continuous improvement
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Collaborate across teams to ensure data quality and consistency
Key Requirements
Experience in performance reporting, PMO, or assurance functions
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to communicate insights clearly to diverse stakeholders
Experience working in structured or regulated environments
NV1 clearance and Australian Citizenship

If this role aligns with your experience and career goals, apply today with your latest resume.
